name: Rfissa Fassiya
ingredients: 1 free-range chicken cut into pieces (or 6 thighs)
Bouquet of tied coriander and parsley
Tride / Msemen (12–16 thin sheets or 6–8 homemade msemen, cut into pieces)
Spices: 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp ground ginger, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp pepper, 1 tsp ras el hanout, salt, a pinch of saffron (optional), 1 tbsp smen (fermented butter, added at the end)
steps: Prepare the chicken: Rub it with the basic spices (ginger, turmeric, pepper, salt, ras el hanout) and oil. Let it marinate (optional).
In a large pot, sauté the onions and garlic. Add the chicken and lightly brown it.
Add the tied herb bouquet, rinsed lentils, rinsed fenugreek seeds, and cover with hot water. Let it simmer on low heat until the chicken and lentils are tender.
During cooking, roughly crumble the tride/msemen sheets and place them in a large deep dish. Steam the tride to warm and soften it (optional).
Remove the herb bouquet from the broth. Stir the smen into the broth for an authentic touch (optional).
Plating: Arrange the chicken on the bed of tride/msemen and generously pour the broth with lentils over it. Let it rest for 5–10 minutes off the heat before serving very hot.
